posts.post_content:
This, much like [Devastation Tide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Devastation Tide), was \*highly\* needed to deal with a board full of enemy tokens or a Sigarda.  
  
With creatures and aggro strategies seemingly getting stronger every set,  
cards like this are a necessity to keep things in balance.  
  
Also, the art is incredible- I **must** have one in foil!

Posted By: gongshowninja (5/2/2012 1:13:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is pretty insane, and I think will become the board wipe spell of choice in standard. A lot of creatures enjoy being in the graveyard, but not so much being on the bottom of the library where they can't be easily brought back. As in, this costs only one more than [Hallowed Burial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hallowed Burial) which is already a great card (that people HATE seeing in Commander, so this is essentially your second copy if you use it) but the Miracle cost puts it over the top.
posts.html:

Posted By: wstonefi (8/4/2013 9:57:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Whenever I hear people about how to make a creature almost untouchable, like with other cards that give it hexproof or indestructibility, my first thought of an answer to that is always Terminus.  
  
In standard, this card doesn't care about [Voice of Resurgence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of Resurgence)'s elemental token, [Lotleth Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotleth Troll)'s regenerate, or [Falkenrath Aristocrat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Falkenrath Aristocrat)'s indestructibility.  
  
5/5
posts.html:

5/5
